content.description: Begin with a thin start up to a stepped-out slab, then move up to a slightly steeper topout. Basically go straight up the center of the face.
content.protection: Solo, and this would only take gear near the top anyway.
content.location: It is straight back behind the clubhouse along one of the small ponds.

content.description: Mount Hood Public Golf Course has some good sized slabs and boulders along the fairways in several areas. The one directly behind the clubhouse has a lot of options.It’s a golf course, so any time people are using the course, you obviously shouldn’t be cragging. Winter, nighttime, other miscellaneous off hours should keep you out of trouble. It’s a heavily used sledding, XC ski, and snowshoe area in winter, and people walk their dogs here year-round.
